description: The taboo relationship between young Nadav and his Aunt Nina transcends definition on its way to odd highs and lows.
keywords: nephew attracted to aunt,nude pregnant woman,incestuous desire,oedipus complex,female masturbation
name: Ha-Asonot Shel Nina

review.name: a brilliantly sad comedy
review.reviewBody: I just saw this at the San Francisco Jewish Film Festival and loved it. It didn't feel like most movies I've seen lately. It didn't try to make the main character change for the better. It accepted all the flaws and moved on, focusing on the story. I loved all the connections and the fact that it's advertised to be "a very sad comedy" is exactly right. it is hilarious at some parts, and you want to cry at others, but it works. it's real. i loved it. beautiful cinematography and acting. Another thing i liked about the movie was it was genuinely from a little boy's point of view. when he has the dream with the man's voice becoming a telephone ring, that was priceless and clearly something that a little child would dream because it would be stuck in their heads. great movie. see it :)
